function.description: Calculate the missing side or angles of a triangle given some sides or angles using trigonometric properties.
function.name: solve_triangle_sides

angle_C.description: Angle C opposite the side c.

function.description: Calculates properties of a triangle given the side lengths or coordinates of its vertices.
function.name: calculate_triangle_properties

vertex1.description: Coordinates of the first vertex [x, y].

vertex2.description: Coordinates of the second vertex [x, y].

vertex3.description: Coordinates of the third vertex [x, y].

function.description: Calculate the volume of a sphere given its radius.
function.name: volume_of_sphere

function.description: Calculate the volume of a sphere given its diameter or radius.
function.name: calculate_spherical_volume

function.description: Calculate the remaining leg of a right triangle given one leg and the hypotenuse using the Pythagorean theorem.
function.name: calculate_right_triangle_leg

hypotenuse.description: The length of the hypotenuse of the triangle.

leg.description: The length of the known leg of the triangle.

function.description: Calculates the volume and surface area of a cone given its height and radius.
function.name: calculate_cone_properties

radius.description: The radius of the base of the cone.

function.description: Solves for the third side of a right triangle using the Pythagorean Theorem when two side lengths are provided.
function.name: solve_pythagorean_theorem

a.description: The length of one side (not the hypotenuse) of the triangle.

b.description: The length of the other side (not the hypotenuse) of the triangle.

function.description: Calculate the Euclidean distance between two points in 3D space.
function.name: calculate_distance_3d

function.description: Evaluate arithmetic or mathematical expressions provided as strings.
function.name: evaluate_expression

function.description: Calculate the Euclidean distance between two points in any dimension.
function.name: calculate_distance

point1.description: The first point as an array of coordinates.

point2.description: The second point as an array of coordinates.
